principal.name: Dra. Silvia M. Arribas Rodríguez
principal.position: Head of area: Oxidavive Stress, Fetal Programming and Cardiometabolic Health
principal.bio: PhD in Biomolecular Sciences. Her research was focused on the fetal programming of the cardiovascular disease. She has extensive expertis in the oxidative stress pathways and their implication to physio-pathology balance. She was head of Physiology Department where is Professor of human physiology.

principal.name: Dra. María Ángeles Martín Cabrejas
principal.position: Head of area: Food Technology and New Ingredient Development.
principal.bio: PhD in Chemical Sciences. Her research studies the revalorization of agri-food by-products as strategy to obtain new ingredients. She has experience in the characterization of plant-derived products and their conversion into food ingredients. She is Full Professor receiving the Plan for Research and Technological Innovation award (Spain).

junior.name: Dr. Ignacio Monedero Cobeta
junior.bio: PhD in Molecular Biology. He is a specialist in developmental biology and molecular factors to control neuronal division. He studies the proliferation of the nervous system and its effect on memory. He is an Associate Professor of Physiology of the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid.

junior.name: Dra. Yolanda Aguilera Gutiérrez
junior.bio: PhD in Food Science and Technology. Her research focuses on insects for human consumption and the effect on health by antioxidant compounds. She is an Associate Professor in the Agricultural Chemistry Unit of the Universidad Autonoma de Madrid.

junior.name: Dr. David Ramiro Cortijo
junior.bio: PhD in Pharmacology and Physiology. He is focuse on perinatal stage and psycho-biological aspect of health. He is an Assistant Professor of Physiology in the Universidad Autonoma de Madrid.

junior.name: Dra. Vanesa Benitez García
junior.bio: PhD in Agricultural Chemistry. She is focused on effect of fiber on human health. She is an Associate Professor in the Agricultural Chemistry Unit of the Universidad Autonoma de Madrid.

junior.name: Dra. Pilar Rodríguez Rodríguez
junior.position: Fetal Programming unit and Animal models.
junior.bio: PhD in Pharmacology and Physiology. She explores, in animal models, the oxidative stress and pathways related of cardiovascular health and diseases.

junior.name: Dra. Alicia Gil Ramírez
junior.bio: PhD in Biology and Food Sciences. She studies the sustainable technologies in food to promote health. She is an Assistant Professor of Agricultural Chemistry Unit of the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid.

postdoctoral.name: Dra. Andrea Gila Díaz
postdoctoral.bio: Nurse and PhD in Pharmacology and Physiology. Specialist in nutrition maternal health and promote the breastfeeding.

postdoctoral.name: Dr. Miguel Rebollo Hernánz
postdoctoral.bio: Chemist and PhD in Food Science and Technology. Specialist in molecular pathways related to biactive compounds of food.

phd.name: Santiago Ruvira Hernando
phd.bio: Nutritionist and dietician specializing in human physiology. Focused on the study of cardiovascular improvements through functional foods.

phd.name: Silvia Cañas Rodríguez
phd.bio: Food thecnologist specializing in biactive compounds. Focused on the study of cardiovascular improvements through functional foods.

phd.name: Cheyenne Braojos Molero
phd.bio: Food thecnologist specializing in biactive compounds. Focused on the study of cardiovascular improvements through functional foods.
